TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HealthServiceActionPage extends Microsoft.Health.Web.HealthServicePage

Docs.summary: A redirector page to be used as the "action" page for Microsoft HealthVault applications.
Docs.remarks:
All HealthVault applications are required to expose a set of URLs for information and functionality that they expose. For instance, all applications must expose a Service Agreement, privacy statement, a home page, help, etc.
This page acts as a simple redirector for these action pages such that the application can easily configure these action pages through their web.config file.
To use this page, create an action.aspx file at the URL that was specified for the "action URL" when your application was registered. That action.aspx file should point to this class for it's implementation. In your web.config file, add entries for each of the action URLs that your application supports using WCPage_Action as the prefix for the key. For example, for the Service Agreement action URL create a setting in the web.config with key WCPage_ActionServiceAgreement and value containing the URL to your application Service Agreement.
The page should also contain some text stating that the application doesn't support the particular action in case the redirect doesn't occur. The action that is being requested can be found in the property and the action query string can be found the property.

Docs.summary: Gets the action that was specified in the query string.
Docs.remarks:
The currently supported actions are:
Home
ServiceAgreement
Help
AppAuthSuccess
AppAuthFailure
AppAuthReject
AppAuthInvalidRecord
CreateRecordFailure
CreateRecordCanceled
ReconcileComplete
ReconcileFailure
ReconcileCanceled
SelectedRecordChanged
SignOut
ShareRecordSuccess
ShareRecordFailed
Privacy

Docs.param: The action identifier used to tell the application which action page should be shown.
The query string parameters that should be passed to the target action URL.
Docs.summary: Gets the URL of the location and the query string for the specified action.
Docs.returns: The full URL including query string of the action page to redirect to.
Docs.remarks:
The default implementation reads the action URL from the web.config file using the key "WCPage_Action" + .
The currently supported actions are:
Home
ServiceAgreement
Help
AppAuthSuccess
AppAuthFailure
AppAuthReject
AppAuthInvalidRecord
CreateRecordFailure
CreateRecordCanceled
ReconcileComplete
ReconcileFailure
ReconcileCanceled
SelectedRecordChanged
SignOut
ShareRecordSuccess
ShareRecordFailed
Privacy

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnActionApplicationAuthorizationFailed (string action, string actionQueryString);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnActionApplicationAuthorizationFailed(string action, string actionQueryString) cil managed

Docs.param: Should always be "APPAUTHFAILURE".
The value of the "actionqs" query string parameter.
Docs.summary: Redirects to the application's authorization page using the WCPage_ActionAppAuthFailure configuration value in the web.config.
Docs.remarks: The default implementation of this method calls to redirect to the URL defined by the web.config file or the . To change this behavior the application can override this method and provide a different implementation. can be called to get the URL from the web.config file if needed.

Docs.param: Should always be "SELECTEDRECORDCHANGED".
The value of the "actionqs" query string parameter.
Docs.summary: Redirects to the application's record management page using the WCPage_ActionSelectedRecordChanged configuration value in the web.config.
Docs.remarks: The default implementation of this method refreshes the user's cookie by calling and then calls to redirect to the URL defined by the web.config file or the . To change this behavior the application can override this method and provide a different implementation. can be called to get the URL from the web.config file if needed.

Docs.param: The action that is being redirected to.
The action query string parameters to pass on to the action page.
Docs.summary: Redirects to the specified action page if specified in the web.config file.
Docs.remarks: If the target action specified to the action page is not one of the recognized actions it can still be handled by the application by specifying a URL to redirect to in the web.config file. If the web.config file doesn't have a redirect URL for the action and the contains only a URL, the user's browser will be directed to that URL instead. The key should be WCPage_Action with the action name appended. For example, WCPage_ActionAppAuthSuccess can be used to specify a URL for the AppAuthSuccess action.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void Page_Load (object sender, EventArgs e);
.method familyhidebysig instance void Page_Load(object sender, class System.EventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Sub Page_Load (sender As Object, e As EventArgs)
member this.Page_Load : obj * EventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: The sender of the message.
The arguments of the message.
Docs.summary: Reads the target from the query string calls the appropriate virtual method to perform the action.
Docs.remarks: In most cases the action performed is to redirect the user's browser to a URL defined by the web.config file or if that isn't defined and the is a URL to that URL instead.
